info.title: Cycode API Documentation v4
info.description: Welcome to the Cycode API Reference guide! The guide covers the APIs used in the Cycode platform, including handling policies, violations, integrations, Assets, and more.

get.description: Fetches a paginated list of audit logs based on the provided filter criteria.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Filter logs created *after* or exactly at this timestamp (inclusive). Format: ISO 8601 DateTimeOffset (e.g., '2025-04-22T10:00:00Z').

schema.description: Filter logs created *after* or exactly at this timestamp (inclusive). Format: ISO 8601 DateTimeOffset (e.g., '2025-04-22T10:00:00Z').

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: Filter logs created *before* or exactly at this timestamp (inclusive). Format: ISO 8601 DateTimeOffset (e.g., '2025-04-22T14:55:10+03:00').

schema.description: Filter logs created *before* or exactly at this timestamp (inclusive). Format: ISO 8601 DateTimeOffset (e.g., '2025-04-22T14:55:10+03:00').

parameters.name: subject_type
parameters.description: Filter logs based on the type of the entity that was acted upon.

schema.description: Filter logs based on the type of the entity that was acted upon.

parameters.name: excluded_subject_type
parameters.description: Exclude logs where the subject type matches any of the provided types.

schema.description: Exclude logs where the subject type matches any of the provided types.

parameters.name: subject_id
parameters.description: Filter logs based on the specific ID of the entity that was acted upon.

schema.description: Filter logs based on the specific ID of the entity that was acted upon.

parameters.name: actor_id
parameters.description: Filter logs based on the internal ID of the user or service principal that performed the action.

schema.description: Filter logs based on the internal ID of the user or service principal that performed the action.

parameters.name: external_actor_id
parameters.description: Filter logs based on an external identifier for the actor (e.g., an ID from an external identity provider).

schema.description: Filter logs based on an external identifier for the actor (e.g., an ID from an external identity provider).

parameters.name: external_user_provider
parameters.description: Filter logs based on the provider or source of the external actor.

schema.description: Filter logs based on the provider or source of the external actor.

parameters.name: action
parameters.description: Filter logs based on the specific action performed.

schema.description: Filter logs based on the specific action performed.

parameters.name: reviewed
parameters.description: Filter logs based on their review status. `true` for reviewed, `false` for unreviewed, omit to include both.

schema.description: Filter logs based on their review status. `true` for reviewed, `false` for unreviewed, omit to include both.

parameters.name: search_data
parameters.description: The text or value to search for within the field(s) specified by `search_by`.

schema.description: The text or value to search for within the field(s) specified by `search_by`.

parameters.name: is_activity_log
parameters.description: Filter specifically for logs categorized as 'activity logs'. Omit to include all types.

schema.description: Filter specifically for logs categorized as 'activity logs'. Omit to include all types.

parameters.name: should_return_minimized_log
parameters.description: Set to `true` to receive a minimized version of the log entries, potentially omitting detailed metadata. Defaults to `false`.

schema.description: Set to `true` to receive a minimized version of the log entries, potentially omitting detailed metadata. Defaults to `false`.

parameters.name: should_filter_cycode_user
parameters.description: Set to `true` to automatically exclude logs generated by internal Cycode system processes. Defaults to `false`.

schema.description: Set to `true` to automatically exclude logs generated by internal Cycode system processes. Defaults to `false`.

parameters.name: ip_address
parameters.description: Filter logs based on the source IP address from which the action originated.

schema.description: Filter logs based on the source IP address from which the action originated.

parameters.name: repository_name
parameters.description: Filter logs based on the repository name.

schema.description: Filter logs based on the repository name.

parameters.name: last_reviewed_by
parameters.description: Filter logs based on the last reviewer.

schema.description: Filter logs based on the last reviewer.

parameters.name: should_count_total
parameters.description: Set to `false` to potentially speed up the query by omitting the calculation of the total number of matching logs. Defaults to `true`.

schema.description: Set to `false` to potentially speed up the query by omitting the calculation of the total number of matching logs. Defaults to `true`.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to return per page.

schema.description: The maximum number of items to return per page.

parameters.name: next_page_token
parameters.description: A token representing the position to fetch the next page of results from. Used for cursor-based pagination.

schema.description: A token representing the position to fetch the next page of results from. Used for cursor-based pagination.

parameters.name: sort_by
parameters.description: Specifies the field(s) to sort the results by. By default, sorting is ascending. Prefix the field name with a hyphen (`-`) for descending order (e.g., `name` for ascending, `-name` for descending). Provide multiple values for multi-field sorting.

schema.description: Specifies the field(s) to sort the results by. By default, sorting is ascending. Prefix the field name with a hyphen (`-`) for descending order (e.g., `name` for ascending, `-name` for descending). Provide multiple values for multi-field sorting.

tags.name: Authentication
tags.description: A [JWT Token](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/JSON_Web_Token), as a [Bearer Authentication](https://swagger.io/docs/specification/authentication/bearer-authentication/) token, is **required** to use the Cycode APIs. For detailed information about token generation and management, see the [Personal Access Token](#tag/Personal-Access-Token) and [Service Access Token](#tag/Service-Account-Access-Token) sections.

tags.name: Personal Access Token
tags.description:
Access Tokens allow users to create personal API access tokens based on their users current role in the current tenant or business group. Personal access tokens enable you to access the Cycode APIs using your specific user (including all of the access your user has). We recommend not using this token for CI/CD pipelines, as a specific user may not always remain active or available. For this use case, see Creating a Service Account Access Token for the purposes of CI/CD pipeline builds.

Note that the allowed user roles for personal access token are: Admin, Owner, Member, and Viewer.

## Viewing your personal access tokens
To view your personal access token, click the profile icon in the right-hand corner, select **My Profile**, and then select **Personal Access Tokens** in the left pane.


In the Personal Access Tokens page, you'll be able to create custom API tokens based on your role in the tenant or business group. These tokens offer secure, role-based access to Cycode APIs, ensuring smooth platform use while safeguarding data and user control.

## Adding access tokens

1. To add a new access token, click **New Access Token**. This displays the New Access Token dialog.
2. Enter an internal name for the access token and click **Create**. Once the new token is created, the Access Token Client ID & Secret dialog is displayed.
The new access token displays the Client IDS and Client Secret, as well as the JWT Access Token and Usage Example.

> **Important**:
>
> Once you close the Access Token dialog, the Client Secret will no longer be recoverable. Be sure to save these IDs in a safe place.

3. Click **Done** to close the dialog.
The new token will now appear in your list of tokens.

tags.name: Service Account Access Token
tags.description:
Service account access tokens allow users to control the access level to Cycode's APIs and are not tied directly to a specific user. This token is best used for integrating Cycode with CI/CD pipeline processes.

If there is a need to use a specific user's access to Cycode's APIs, see the Creating a Personal Access Token article for details on this access token type.

## Creating a Service Account Access Token steps
1. Log in to the Cycode platform and click the settings cog in the top right corner of the screen
2. Click on the **Service Accounts** link in the left sidebar.
3. Click the **Create New** button.
4. Enter a description in the pop-up window, select an access level, and click the **Create** button.
5. Save the Client ID and Secret ID in the new pop-up window.

> **Important**:
>
> Once this pop-up is closed, the Client Secret will no longer be recoverable. Be sure to save these IDs in a safe place!

> **Note**:
>
> You can use the **Get a JWT Access Token** curl command to generate a token, copy the command into your Postman or CLI.

6. Once the Client Secret and ID have been saved, click the **Close** button. You will see your new key listed.

tags.name: Changelog
tags.description:
### API Version 4.0
- `10-08-2025` - Introduced "Compliance" APIs
- `15-07-2025` - Enhanced Label Resources APIs with improved parameter handling and new bulk operations **including endpoint deprecations**
- `15-07-2025` - Introduced new SBOM import management APIs including bulk delete and replace operations
- `15-07-2025` - Enhanced collision calculation APIs with direct collision filtering
- `19-05-2025` - Added Reports related APIs
- `12-05-2025` - Added Audit log related APIs
